content.description: Fun little "boulder problem". 5.12a for sure but kind of funny gimmie climb.
content.location: The farthest bolted line to the right, at the very very end past Shaft of The Penetrator.

content.description:
The most right hand route on the Knobby Wall.

Pumpy with sloper knob holds.

This is the rightmost of the two obvious (chalked) right-leaning flakes at Knobby Wall.  Start on a nice jug in the flake and follow it via fingers to a rest stance about two thirds of the way up (5.10).  Make a transition to a right-hand flake and then fire the crimpy 2-move crux to a sloper jug at the lip (5.11).
content.protection: 3 bolts can be clipped to left of the flake (shared with the route Changos Cabrones). But this flake can also be led entirely on gear (finger-sized cams) or TR'd (beware of the huge swing potential into boulders if you fall in the first half).  If you're near your limit, you'll probably want to clip the bolts and place one or two pieces for additional protection.

content.description: Meltdown is cruxy from the start, getting to the first bolt is difficult and I would recommend stick clipping, or rapping in and clipping the bolts, or being a hard-man. From the start follow broken cracks and good holds up and left and then out and right to several big jumps, the final moves on this route are not to be forgotten.
content.protection: Several Bolts to two bolt anchor on top.
content.location: As you walk up to Knobby wall this is the middle bolted line, center direct! on the face just right of the big overhanging crack climb. (the first bolted line to the right of this crack.)

climbs.name: Keep the Muscle, Lose The Fat

content.description: Start the same as The Flake, but head left out onto the extremely overhung wall following a bolted line to the top of the boulder. Several 5.13 cruxes exist on this route, but its not to be missed.
content.protection: 1 black diamond .75 for the starting crack, then follow several bolts.
content.location: Left of the big flake, only bolted line on the left side.

content.description: The obvious flake on the wall continues to the top of the knobby wall.
content.protection: 2nd belay is suggested for not swinging behind at the first few feet not to hit the rocks around it.
